questions.question: What is the theme of a story?

choices.answer: The message, moral, or lesson of the story
The main idea of the story

questions.question: Theme? Kylee played instead of studying, and she failed the test. David studied, and he passed.

choices.answer: Playing is more fun than studying

questions.question: Theme? No one liked Kat. She didn't have nice clothes, but she was really funny and nice.

choices.answer: Don't judge someone by how they treat others.
Don't judge someone by their looks.

questions.question: When writing a summary about the theme you should....

choices.answer: Write what the message shows you.
Include the theme in the first sentence.

questions.question: True or False? There can only be one theme to each story.
Theme? What is the theme of "The Boy Who Cried Wolf"?

choices.answer: If you lie a lot, people won't ever believe you.
It is okay to lie sometimes.

questions.question: True of False? One of the themes in the "Three Little Pigs" is hard work pays off.
Theme?  Tim didn't have as many toys as Ken, but Tim was loved by his family and he was happy!

choices.answer: Tim should be jealous of Ken.
Love is more important than material things.
Having toys should make you happy.

questions.question: True or False? A theme in "The Ugly Duckling" is don't judge someone by their looks.
